results.title: Features of complex medicamental therapy in patients with silent myocardial ischemia of high risk after myocardial infarction.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: Aim: To determine the peculiarities of the course of silent @DISEASE_Myocardial_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D017202 @@@myocardial ischemia@@@ (@DISEASE_Thalassemia_Beta+_Silent_Allele @DISEASE_MESH:C566065 @@@SMI@@@) in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@post-infarction cardiosclerosis@@@ depending on the risk factors (RFs); to reveal the interdependence between the presence of pathological turbulence of the heart rhythm and the peculiarities of the course of @DISEASE_Thalassemia_Beta+_Silent_Allele @DISEASE_MESH:C566065 @@@SMI@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@post-infarction cardiosclerosis@@@ and the effectiveness of treatment applying @CHEMICAL_Sulfur @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013455 @@@S@@@-@<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ in complex therapy.

citations.NLM: Merhel TV, Naluzhna TV, Levandovska KV. Features of complex medicamental therapy in patients with silent myocardial ischemia of high risk after myocardial infarction. Wiad Lek. 2025;78(2):328-335. PMID: 40125748
citations.BibTeX: @article{40125748, title={Features of complex medicamental therapy in patients with silent myocardial ischemia of high risk after myocardial infarction.}, author={Merhel TV and Naluzhna TV and Levandovska KV}, journal={Wiad Lek}, volume={78}, number={2}, pages={328-335}}

results.title: Reduction in infarct size by chronic amlodipine treatment in cholesterol-fed rabbits.
results.text_hl: Reduction in @<m>DISEASE_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarct@@@ size by chronic @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ treatment in @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@-fed @SPECIES_9986 @@@rabbits@@@.

results.title: Effects of amlodipine on myocardial infarction, infarct expansion, and ventricular geometry in the rat.
results.text_hl: Effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ on @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarct@@@ expansion, and ventricular geometry in the @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@.

results.title: Opposite effects of amlodipine and enalapril on infarct collagen and remodelling during healing after reperfused myocardial infarction.
results.text_hl: However, compared with no reperfusion, @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ preserved @<m>DISEASE_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarct@@@ wall thickness and shape while @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ decreased @<m>DISEASE_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarct@@@ wall thickness and increased the shape index.

citations.NLM: Jugdutt BI, Musat-Marcu S. Opposite effects of amlodipine and enalapril on infarct collagen and remodelling during healing after reperfused myocardial infarction. Can J Cardiol. 2000 May;16(5):617-25. PMID: 10833541
citations.BibTeX: @article{10833541, title={Opposite effects of amlodipine and enalapril on infarct collagen and remodelling during healing after reperfused myocardial infarction.}, author={Jugdutt BI and Musat-Marcu S}, journal={Can J Cardiol}, volume={16}, number={5}, pages={617-25}}

results.title: Amlodipine inhibits granulation tissue cell apoptosis through reducing calcineurin activity to attenuate postinfarction cardiac remodeling.
results.journal: Am J Physiol Heart Circ Physiol
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ inhibits Fas-mediated granulation tissue cell apoptosis in @<m>DISEASE_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarcted hearts@@@, possibly by attenuating the activities of calcineurin and Bad.

citations.NLM: Ogino A, Takemura G, Kanamori H, Okada H, Maruyama R, Miyata S, Esaki M, Nakagawa M, Aoyama T, Ushikoshi H, Kawasaki M, Minatoguchi S, Fujiwara T, Fujiwara H. Amlodipine inhibits granulation tissue cell apoptosis through reducing calcineurin activity to attenuate postinfarction cardiac remodeling. Am J Physiol Heart Circ Physiol. 2007 Oct;293(4):H2271-80. PMID: 17644576

results.title: Therapeutic drugs during healing after myocardial infarction modify infarct collagens and ventricular distensibility at elevated pressures.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@Infarct@@@ thinning was prevented by @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Isosorbide_Dinitrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007548 @@@ISDN@@@ but enhanced by @CHEMICAL_Indomethacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007213 @@@indomethacin@@@.

citations.NLM: Jugdutt BI, Idikio H, Uwiera RR. Therapeutic drugs during healing after myocardial infarction modify infarct collagens and ventricular distensibility at elevated pressures. Mol Cell Biochem. 2007 Oct;304(1-2):79-91. PMID: 17487453
citations.BibTeX: @article{17487453, title={Therapeutic drugs during healing after myocardial infarction modify infarct collagens and ventricular distensibility at elevated pressures.}, author={Jugdutt BI and Idikio H and Uwiera RR}, journal={Mol Cell Biochem}, volume={304}, number={1-2}, pages={79-91}}

results.title: Biphasic survival response to amlodipine after myocardial infarction in rats: Association with cardiac vascular remodeling.
results.text_hl: In this study, @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ exacerbated muscle proliferation in @<m>DISEASE_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarct@@@ vessels and was associated with less scar collagen.

citations.NLM: Whittaker P, Zhang HP, Kloner RA. Biphasic survival response to amlodipine after myocardial infarction in rats: Association with cardiac vascular remodeling. Cardiovasc Pathol. 2000 Mar-Apr;9(2):85-93. PMID: 10867358
citations.BibTeX: @article{10867358, title={Biphasic survival response to amlodipine after myocardial infarction in rats: Association with cardiac vascular remodeling.}, author={Whittaker P and Zhang HP and Kloner RA}, journal={Cardiovasc Pathol}, volume={9}, number={2}, pages={85-93}}

results.title: Cardioprotective effects of amlodipine in animal models of ischemia and reperfusion.
results.text_hl: In a @SPECIES_9615 @@@canine@@@ model of regional @DISEASE_Myocardial_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D017202 @@@myocardial ischemia@@@ (6 h) followed by reperfusion, @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ at 150 microg/kg, administered 15 min before reperfusion (90 min), reduced @<m>DISEASE_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarct@@@ size expressed as a percentage of the area at risk (34.5 +/- 3.8% vs. 45.9 +/- 2.8%, p = 0.027).

citations.NLM: Lucchesi BR, Hoff PT, Tamura Y. Cardioprotective effects of amlodipine in animal models of ischemia and reperfusion. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1991;17 Suppl 1():S34-9. PMID: 16296706
citations.BibTeX: @article{16296706, title={Cardioprotective effects of amlodipine in animal models of ischemia and reperfusion.}, author={Lucchesi BR and Hoff PT and Tamura Y}, journal={J Cardiovasc Pharmacol}, volume={17 Suppl 1}, pages={S34-9}}

results.title: Cardioprotective effects of amlodipine in the ischemic-reperfused heart.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@Infarct@@@ size, expressed as a percentage of the area at risk, was smaller in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@-treated group (n = 10) than in the control group (n = 10) (34.5 +/- 3.8% vs 45.9 +/- 2.8%, p = 0.027).

citations.NLM: Hoff PT, Tamura Y, Lucchesi BR. Cardioprotective effects of amlodipine in the ischemic-reperfused heart. Am J Cardiol. 1989 Nov 7;64(17):101I-115I discussion 115I-116I. PMID: 2530882
citations.BibTeX: @article{2530882, title={Cardioprotective effects of amlodipine in the ischemic-reperfused heart.}, author={Hoff PT and Tamura Y and Lucchesi BR}, journal={Am J Cardiol}, volume={64}, number={17}, pages={101I-115I discussion 115I-116I}}
